intro: Lardizabala, commonly known as the Andean mountain potato, is a genus of flowering plants native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its tuberous roots that are rich in starch. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often at elevations above 3,000 meters. Its tubers are used as a food source by local communities and have been cultivated for centuries. Lardizabala species are also valued for their ornamental value due to their attractive, often colorful flowers.
